trans-unit.source: Represents a single, constant set of pixels at a certain size and resolution.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> is the basic building block of the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] imaging pipeline, conceptually representing a single, constant set of pixels at a certain size and resolution.

A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> could be a single frame in an image file that a decoder provides, or it could be the result of a transform that operates on a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> of its own.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> is not used to represent a multi-frame image or an animation.

[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] natively supports compression and decompression of [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_bmp](~/includes/tlasharptla-bmp-md.md)], [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)], [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_jpegorg](~/includes/tlasharptla-jpegorg-md.md)], [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_png](~/includes/tlasharptla-png-md.md)], and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] images.
For bitmap decoding scenarios, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> uses automatic codec discovery, based on the installed codecs on the user's system.
The maximum height and width of an image is 2^16 pixels at 32 bits per channel * 4 channels.
The maximum size of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> is 2^32 bytes (64 gigabytes) and the maximum image size is four gigapixels.
The minimum image size is 1x1.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> class.
Checks whether the bitmap source content is from a known site of origin.
This method is used to make sure that pixel copying operations are safe.
This method only succeeds if it is passed a <xref:System.Uri> that is from a site of origin or that is defined in a `pack:`.
In all other conditions, this method will fail.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Makes this instance a deep copy of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref>.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when you call the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a modifiable copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> to clone..
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Makes this instance a modifiable deep copy of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> using current property values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when you call the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a modifiable copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValueCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> to clone.
Copies the bitmap pixel data into an array of pixels with the specified stride, starting at the specified offset.
The destination array.
The stride of the bitmap.
The pixel location where copying starts.
Copies the bitmap pixel data within the specified rectangle into an array of pixels that has the specified stride starting at the specified offset.
An empty `sourceRect` value (specified as all zeros) copies the entire bitmap.
The source rectangle to copy.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect.Empty"></xref> value specifies the entire bitmap.
The destination array.
The stride of the bitmap.
The pixel location where copying begins.
Copies the bitmap pixel data within the specified rectangle
An empty `sourceRect` value (specified as all zeros) copies the entire bitmap.
The source rectangle to copy.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect.Empty"></xref> value specifies the entire bitmap.
A pointer to the buffer.
The size of the buffer.
The stride of the bitmap.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> from an array of pixels.
The width of the bitmap.
The height of the bitmap.
The horizontal [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dpi](~/includes/tlasharptla-dpi-md.md)] of the bitmap.
The vertical [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dpi](~/includes/tlasharptla-dpi-md.md)] of the bitmap.
The pixel format of the bitmap.
The palette of the bitmap.
An array of bytes that represents the content of a bitmap image.
The stride of the bitmap.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that is created from the specified array of pixels.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> from an array of pixels that are stored in unmanaged memory.
The width of the bitmap.
The height of the bitmap.
The horizontal [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dpi](~/includes/tlasharptla-dpi-md.md)] of the bitmap.
The vertical [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dpi](~/includes/tlasharptla-dpi-md.md)] of the bitmap.
The pixel format of the bitmap.
The palette of the bitmap.
A pointer to the buffer that contains the bitmap data in memory.
The size of the buffer.
The stride of the bitmap.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that is created from the array of pixels in unmanaged memory.
Occurs when the image fails to load, due to a corrupt image header.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.DecodeFailed> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
XAML Text Usage
\<*object* DecodeFailed="*EventHandler*" .../>
Occurs when the bitmap content has been completely downloaded.
This event may not be raised for all types of bitmap content.
Occurs when the bitmap content failed to download.
This event may not be raised for all types of bitmap content.
XAML Text Usage
\<*object* DownloadFailed="*EventHandler*" .../>
Occurs when the download progress of the bitmap content has changed.
This event may not be raised for all types of bitmap content.
XAML Text Usage
\<*object* DownloadProgress="*EventHandler*" .../>
Gets the horizontal [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dpi](~/includes/tlasharptla-dpi-md.md)] of the image.
The horizontal [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dpi](~/includes/tlasharptla-dpi-md.md)] of the image; that is, the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dpi](~/includes/tlasharptla-dpi-md.md)] along the x-axis.
Gets the vertical [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dpi](~/includes/tlasharptla-dpi-md.md)] of the image.
The vertical [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dpi](~/includes/tlasharptla-dpi-md.md)] of the image; that is, the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dpi](~/includes/tlasharptla-dpi-md.md)] along the y-axis.
Gets the native <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat"></xref> of the bitmap data.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> is directly readable, this is the format that the pixels will be in when they are read.
The pixel format of the bitmap data.
Makes an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> or a derived class immutable.
`true` if this instance should actually freeze itself when this method is called; otherwise, `false`.
If isChecking is `true`, this method returns `true` if this can be made unmodifiable, or `false` if it cannot be made unmodifiable.

If isChecking is `false`, this method returns `true` if the if this is now unmodifiable, or `false` if it cannot be made unmodifiable, with the side effect of having begun to change the frozen status of this object.
Makes this instance a clone of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> object.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

Note that if these properties contain resource references or data bindings, <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> will fail when trying to freeze the object and will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a frozen copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozenCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> object to clone and freeze.
Makes this instance a frozen clone of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref>.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetCurrentValueAsFrozen%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a frozen copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetCurrentValueAsFrozen%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetCurrentValueAsFrozenCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> to copy and freeze.
Gets the height of the source bitmap in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)].
The height of the bitmap in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)].
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> content is currently downloading.
`true` if the bitmap source is currently downloading; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the metadata that is associated with this bitmap image.
The metadata that is associated with the bitmap image.
Gets the color palette of the bitmap, if one is specified.
The color palette of the bitmap.
Gets the height of the bitmap in pixels.
The height of the bitmap in pixels.
Gets the width of the bitmap in pixels.
The width of the bitmap in pixels.
Gets the width of the bitmap in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)].
The width of the bitmap in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)].
